Simple Exploration of Ecological Datasets : SEED

La publication : http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/early/2014/10/20/bioinformatics.btu693.full.pdf

Seed is an R/Shiny package for visualizing ecological data. It provides a visual interface for generating a wide variety of plots, including histograms, scatterplots, bar plots, stacked bar plots, PCoA plots, cluster dendrograms, and heatmaps.

Installation des dépendances dans R

Pour le moment à la main mais à scripter … 

$ R
> source("http://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")    
> biocLite(c("preprocessCore","GO.db","impute","Heatplus"))
> install.packages(c("shiny","vegan","WGCNA","gplots","cluster"))

Installation/déploiement

Source : https://github.com/danlbek/Seed

Documentation : https://github.com/danlbek/Seed/blob/master/walkthrough.pdf

URL (de test et provisoire) de l'application : http://134.158.37.10/Seed/ (accessible que depuis les réseaux Bioaster ou via le VPN)

A compléter avec une instance de Shaman ⇒ http://shaman.c3bi.pasteur.fr/
